723785f-b.text:
Vesey Street, north side, at Greenwich Street and West Broadway. At the left are two frame buildings to the west of Greenwich Street. These are No's. 76-8 and 74 Vesey Street. The Ninth Avenue "g1' is on Greenwich Street. East of same is a triangular structure that seperates this thoroughfare fro West Broadway. The entire block beyond is being cleared in View 2. Upon this site rose the new downtown Federal offico building and Post Office. In the background is the distinctive Woolworth Building. View 2 includes the later Transportation
Building.
September, 1914
Oeorge L. Balgue
April 3, 1934
P. L. Sperr
723785f-b.folder: Vesey Street & Greenwich Street, Manhattan, NY

720208f-b.text:
The intersection of Greenwich Street, and West Broadway, at Vesey Street. Shown is Greenwich Street, (Ninth Ave., Elevated) east side, north from Vesey, to, but not including Barclay Streets.
May S, 1927.
P. L. Snerr.
The same location, showing Christmas trees piled outside of these
retail gardener shops for sale to Jersey commuters.
December 11, 1937.
L. Sperr.  NO REPRODUCTIONS.

723795f-a.text:
(1)
72 to 80 Vesey Street, at, adjoining and west of the N.W. corner of Greenwich Street. The 3-story corner house (No. 72) also bears Nos. 206-210 Greenwich Street. Nos. 74 and 76-78 are 2 and 3-story frame
houses respectively.
May 5, 1927.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
A closer view of the fruit market at the corner.
July 26, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.

723792f-b.text:
(1)
Vesey Street, north side, east from (No. 52) but not including West
Broadway, showing a portion of the Sixth Ave. Elevated Line on Church
Street and across it the 18-story Underwood Building at the N.E. corner
of Church Street. The row of buildings from No. 52 to 32, at the N.W.
corner of Church Street (where elevated structure is seen), is part of
the block which was razed to be replaced by a United States Post Office
in 1935.
July 26, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
A detail of the same, from a different angle, showing only Nos. 48
to 54. (These houses are seen in view 1, in the left foreground, in  their reverse order).
July 26, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.
723792f-b.folder: Vesey Street & West Broadway, Manhattan, NY

724353f-a.text:
West Broadway, east side, north from Vesey to Barclay Streets, showing the buildings that stood on the present (1937) site of the United States Post Office. Also shown (right) are buildings on Vesey Street, at, adjoining and east of the N.E. corner.
July 25, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.
724353f-a.folder: West Broadway & Vesey Street, Manhattan, NY

724360f-b.text:
(1S2)
West Broadway, from Vesey (right) to Park (left) Streets, showing the United States Post Office site prior to clearance. This new structure will occupy an entire block, bounded by West Broadway east to Church Street and Vesey north to Barclay Streets. The block to the north of same (left) are still the property of of Columbia University. View No. 2 shows the P.O. site and the block to the south, with Greenwich Street for a westerly boundary and Fulton Street on the south. The "El" in the foreground is on the former while across the top appears the Sixth Avenue line on Church Street. The photographers vantage point is the Telephone Building from which he is viewing eastward.

August 6, 193O

Views 1 and 2
P.L. Sperr

(3)

An additional view in a more northward direction to include a view to Murray Street where the Sixth Avenue "E1" makes a bend eastward towards Church Street. This photograph emphasizes the Columbia property; same being the 2 center blocks and the 3 small block units in the foreground between Greenwich Street and West Broadway.

August 6, 1930

P.L. Sperr

732378f-b.title: Occupations - Peddlers - Flowers.
732378f-b.text:

May 11, 1935.
P. L. Sperr.

718857f-a.text:
(1)
Church Street, at the N.W. corner of Vesey Street. Also shown is Vesey Street, north side, west from Church, to Greenwich Streets. The view shows the new downtown Post Office in process of construction.
Note the Sixth Ave., Elevated across the top of view.
August 21, 1935.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same, from an altitude, and showing West Broadway (across clearance) west side, north from Vesey, to and including Barclay Streets. Note the Ninth Ave., Elevated structure on Greenwich Street.
March 27, 1935.
P. L. Sperr.

720207f-b.text:
Greenwich Street, north from Vesey Street, showing surface conditions under the Ninth Avenue Eleveted Lina West Broadway is at the right, forming a convergence with Greenwich Street at this point. The street car tracks as shown are being removed by the W. P. A. at this date. The old "El" structure overhead will be
demolished sometime in 1940-1.
June 2, 1937
W. P. A. photo
Five Boroughs Project
Greenwich Street, north from Vesey Street.
Vperr  99& A2R6ucroas  May 4, 1941
720207f-b.folder: Greenwich Street & Vesey Street, Manhattan, NY
